Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on the fundamental right to freedom of speech and expression.
It is dangerous for the government to define what is true or false and enforce penalties.
The potential for a regime of total control over public discourse.
Information considered misinformation or disinformation can change over time as new facts emerge.
Policing information is morally wrong and can be done incorrectly without malice.
Notable Quotes: It is dangerous to enable the government to define anything as either true or false and to enforce penalties for straying outside the boundaries thereof.
Facts have a tendency to change when new information comes to light, policing information is not only morally wrong but also may be done incorrectly with no malice involved.
